header.gameNote: HISPANIC COLLEGE FUND CLASSIC AT BATON ROUGE LA

article.headline: Wright State 61, Samford 50
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) -- DaShaun Wood scored a game-high 20 points as the Wright State Raiders defeated Samford 61-50 on Thursday. Wright State (6-6) shot a season high 55.6 percent from the floor and took a 35-30 lead into halftime. Samford (6-5), whose four-game winning streak was snapped by the loss, trailed by just two points, 38-36, with 15:52 remaining in the game. But the Raiders used a 10-2 run midway through the second half to break the game open. The Bulldogs' shooting touch went cold in the final period (28.6 percent) and the team scored just nine points in a nearly 13-minute stretch. In addition to Wood's double-figure scoring, the Raiders' Todd Brown added 12 and Jordan Pleiman had 10. Randall Gulina paced the Bulldogs with 16 points, while Curtis West and Travis Peterson both finished with 11 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
